content.content: As a new member of the Community, I wanted to make a suggestion regarding weekly meetings.  I think it would be really helpful and also more efficient to have a weekly All Hands type call for all of the Core Units. There could be a weekly stand up where all of the Core Units attend and give an update on what they are working on, answer questions, etc.  This meeting could include everyone and replace the other office hour meetings, update meetings, etc, and streamline the Community meetings. I would personally find it beneficial to have a weekly update call on what’s happening in the CUs and what everyone is working on.  Curious to hear others thoughts as well!
Meetings eat a lot of time. I want to know what everybody is working on, but I think it is much more efficient to read per-CU weekly forum posts.

It would be interesting to see all parties talking, but however that would take up a lot of time and consume the agendas of the CUs themselves. For my part I would prefer to keep the post on the forum and an occasional phone call, perhaps at the end of the month, would seem to me to be the most optimal in terms of time efficiency.

Katie:  replace the other office hour meetings   Would recommend against replacing these. The point of them is that anyone can show up and speak to the relevant core unit about stuff, this isn’t possible if there is one meeting where everyone is giving updates. Imo this is important for transparency and accessibility, and it also provides a way for CU people to drop-in with other CU’s to ask questions, clarify joint work, etc, which I feel can help with efficiency - no need to book in a meeting when you can just show up.

I agree with psychonaut. As the numbers of meetings grow, they begin to consume a lot of valuable time for both speakers, listeners, and even the contributors who help transcribe. Written updates provide each team the ability to comprehensively detail their weekly updates at their leisure, potentially resulting in higher-quality updates. Also, David provided a great illustration and breakdown supporting the decision towards written updates.

Thank you all for the feedback! I guess it’s the boomer in me but I really value the face to face communication and feelings of connectedness that builds. I would love to be able to meet with all of the CUs and get a sense of what everyone is working on. Some CUs have office hours but others don’t. The weekly governance calls serve as an all hands in a way so maybe a CU update meeting isn’t necessary.
Katie:  I really value the face to face communication and feelings of connectedness   I value this too. We can try to figure out ways to foster it.
